page.title: 16QUARRYWOOD
page.content:
QUARRYWOOD
Quarrywood lies on the north side of the A96 just west of Elgin. In 1949 the Forestry Commission bought the wood from Elgin City Council. Most of the trees were planted in 1951 or 1952 with some later planting in 1959. There is a mixture of deciduous and conifer trees. There are more Japanese larch than anything else. There are also Scots Pine, Lodgepole and Western Hemlock. Roe-deer, red squirrels and rabbits are very common.
Stone from one of the old quarries was used to renovate old buildings in Elgin. There are lovely walks throughout the wood.
